alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 3:24AM CDT until March 26 at 3:29PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in St Louis MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri... Maries River near Westphalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maries River near Westphalia. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.1 feet, The north end of County Road 521 begins flooding adjacent to the river near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:16 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:16 AM CDT Saturday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 10.8 feet this morning. It will fall below flood stage again early this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Maries River Westphalia 10.0 10.2 4.3 3.3 3.1 2.9 MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
